place.name: HATCH BEAUCHAMP
place.gazetteerText: HATCH-BEAUCHAMP, a village and a parish in Taunton district, Somerset. The village stands near the Hatch station of the Chard and Taunton railway, 6 miles SE of Taunton; has a post office under Taunton; and was once a market town. The parish comprises 1, 120 acres. Real property, £2, 519. Pop., 324. Houses, 78. The property is divided among a few. The manor belonged to the Beauchamps. Hatch Court and Hatch Park are principal residences. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £167.* Patron, N. Gould, Esq. The church is ancient but good; and consists of nave, aisles, and chancel, with a tower. There are chapels for Baptists and Wesleyans, and a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
